src.features package

Submodules

src.features.build_features module

src.features.build_features.data_prep(df, filename, mult_var=None)

Processes the dataset without the use of the pipeline

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – dataset

  • filename (string) – path of the dataset (local)

  • list (mult_var) – list of categorical featuress

src.features.build_features.extract_processed_data()

Extracts the raw data and apply the pipeline to the training and testing data : fits and transforms the datasets It saves the intermediate dataset (for visualisation) and final processed one.

src.features.build_features.fix_typos(df)

Fixes the typos : replaces the commas / converts in MAJ

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – dataset

src.features.build_features.multiple_format(df, mult_var=None)

One-hot encode our categorical features

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – dataset

  • mult_var (list of strings) – list of categorical variables

src.features.build_features.nan(df)

Handles NaN values

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – dataset

src.features.build_features.normalization(df)

Normalizes the data to get same order of magnitude

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – dataset

src.features.build_features.read_data(path)

Reads data and sets/sorts the index

Parameters

path (string) – The path of the dataset.

src.features.pipeline module

Export ou pipeline : preprocessing and XGBClassifier

src.features.pipeline.create_pipeline()

fits the data from the pipeline Besides, we defined our own preprocessing functions : normalize() to process data that arent’ with the same order of magnitude, nan() to drop NaN values Some such as default would be binary features, but since they have a third class “unknown” we’ll process them as non binary categorical Check if the directory exists

src.features.pipeline.read_data(path)

Reads the CSV file/dataset and creates a dataframe from it, sorts the index and sets the appropriated index

Parameters

path (string) – The path of the dataset.
